message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.NI, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the problem of efficient recovery of data stored in a distributed storage system, which is a topic that falls under the scope of information theory (cs.IT) and distributed systems (cs.DS). The focus on minimizing data-read and download also suggests that the paper may be relevant to the sub-category of signal processing (cs.SI), which deals with efficient processing of digital signals. The use of codes to optimize storage and recovery also suggests that the paper may be relevant to the sub-category of networking and internet architecture (cs.NI), which deals with the design and analysis of communication networks. Finally, the paper's focus on lower bounds and achievability results suggests that it may be relevant to the sub-category of computational complexity (cs.CC), which deals with the study of algorithms and their computational complexity.
